ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Unfortunately the class is only available to Japanese speakers, but anyone with a passing interest in Japanese culture, 20th century history, media studies, or sociology should definitely take the class. Television has played a crucial role in Japanese society, and it is a shame that it is not studied more often. I would recommend this class to anyone with the language ability.

The material is challenging and requires advanced Japanese skills as well as patience in dealing with a variety of arguments/methodologies from Japanese scholars. I would recommend the course to another graduate student - or responsible undergraduate - who was interested in obtaining a historically based understanding of the stakes for television in postwar Japan.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: The class was eye-opening. At this point I can't say whether it will factor into my dissertation, but I now know it is a topic I hope to pursue in some form in the future. It has contributed greatly to my knowledge of the discipline by providing a different angle through which I can approach Japanese culture outside of film and literature.
